abstract.text: The
protocol describes the methods that an
object uses to access the contents of its data source object.

abstract.text: Allow users to browse, edit, and save images, using slideshows and Core Image filters.
The
class displays the contents of the selected camera.
The
protocol is adopted by the delegate of the
class. It allows downloading of camera content, handling selection changes, and handling errors.
The
allows you to select a camera or scanner from a list of the available devices.
The
defines the methods that the delegate of the
class can implement. All the methods are optional.
A protocol used to provide a custom UI.
A view for displaying and browsing a large collection of images and movies.
The
class provides a panel, that is, a utility window that floats on top of document windows, optimized for image editing.
The
protocol describes the methods that an
object uses to access the contents of its data source object.
Returns whether the adjust mode view tab should be displayed.
Returns whether the details mode view tab should be displayed.
Returns whether the effects mode view tab should be displayed.
Returns an image.
Returns a dictionary of the image properties associated with the image in the image edit panel.
Sets an image with the specified properties.
Returns a thumbnail image whose size is no larger than the specified size.
The
class displays a view that allows scanning. It can be customized by specifying the display mode. The delegate receives the scanned data and must implement the
protocol.
The
protocol defines the delegate protocol that the
delegate must conform to.
The
class encapsulates a data source and options for a slideshow.
The
protocol describes the methods that an
object uses to access the contents of its data source object.
The
informal protocol declares the methods that an instance of the
class uses to access the contents of its data source object.
The
is an informal protocol for the delegate of an
object. You can implement these methods to perform custom tasks when in response to events in the image browser view.
The
informal protocol declares the methods that an instance of the
class uses to access the contents of its data source for a given item. Some of the methods in this protocol are needed frequently, so you should implement them efficiently.
